result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshawn Monte Lawrence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: FINE OF- $500  inclusive all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges including DNA surcharges), to be paid from  Bail on Deposit any remaining balanc, to be paid by 7-20-2017. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  
Provide DNA Sample (if not already done so).
Court does Object to Electronic Monitoring and Expungement.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve  4 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  

FINE OF- $500  inclusive  all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges including DNA surcharges), to be paid from  Bail on Deposit any remaining balanc, to be paid by 7-20-2017. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment.
					
Provide DNA Sample (if not already done so).

Court does Object to Electronic Monitoring and Expungment.

Notice of Right to Seek Post conviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Deshawn Monte Lawrence in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Deshawn Monte Lawrence in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case set for Jury trial, however, parties have reached a resolution and places negotiations on the record.
Plea Hearing Held:
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  

Jury trial vacated and parties proceeds to sentencing.
State filed motion in limine; jury instructions and witness list.

Defendant Deshawn Monte Lawrence in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Deshawn Monte Lawrence in custody.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense motion to dismiss proceeded by argument from state and defense.  Defense exhibit 1 offered and received.  Court denies the motion to dismiss.    Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Exhibit List, received and filed

Defendant Deshawn Monte Lawrence in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
